snippet: The United States withdrew all staff from its embassy in Syria on Monday, blaming President Bashar al-Assad for escalating violence and mayhem in the country.
abstract: United States withdraws all staff from its embassy in Syria, blaming President Bashar al-Assad for escalating violence and mayhem in the country; move comes at dramatic moment, as the confrontation in Syria turns even more violent and more unpredictable; diplomatic efforts have largely collapsed, save for a Russian delegation visiting Damascus, and both the Syrian government and its opposition have signaled that each believes that the grinding conflict will be resolved only through force of arms.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Steven Lee Myers from Washington, Hwaida Saad and an employee of The New York Times from Beirut, John F. Burns from London, Michael Schwirtz from Moscow, Michael Wines from Beijing, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: The United States withdrew all staff from its embassy in Syria on Monday, blaming President Bashar al-Assad for escalating violence and mayhem in the country.
